csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Money Flow Index (MFI)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Volume-weighted RSI. Measures buying and selling pressure.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Typical Price = (H + L + C) / 3</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>Raw Flow = TP * Volume</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Money Ratio = Positive Flow / Negative Flow</description></item>
15 /// <item><description>MFI = 100 - (100 / (1 + MR))</description></item>
16 /// </list>
17 /// </remarks>
18 public class MoneyFlowIndex
19 {
20 public int Period { get; }
21 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
22​
23 public MoneyFlowIndex(int period = 14)
24 {
25 if (period <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period));
26 Period = period;
27 }
28​
29 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
30 {
31 Values.Clear();
32 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
33 if (candleList.Count < 2) return;
34​
35 var typicalPrices = new List<decimal>();
36 var rawMoneyFlows = new List<decimal>();
37​
38 // Step 1: Pre-calculate Flows
39 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
40 {
41 decimal tp = (candleList[i].High + candleList[i].Low + candleList[i].Close) / 3;
42 typicalPrices.Add(tp);
43 rawMoneyFlows.Add(tp * candleList[i].Volume);
44 }
45​
46 Values.Add(null); // First item has no "previous" to compare
47​
48 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
49 {
50 if (i < Period)
51 {
52 Values.Add(null);
53 continue;
54 }
55​
56 decimal positiveFlow = 0;
57 decimal negativeFlow = 0;
58​
59 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
60 {
61 if (typicalPrices[j] > typicalPrices[j - 1])
62 positiveFlow += rawMoneyFlows[j];
63 else if (typicalPrices[j] < typicalPrices[j - 1])
64 negativeFlow += rawMoneyFlows[j];
65 }
66​
67 if (negativeFlow == 0)
68 {
69 Values.Add(100);
70 }
71 else
72 {
73 decimal mfr = positiveFlow / negativeFlow;
74 decimal mfi = 100 - (100 / (1 + mfr));
75 Values.Add(Math.Max(0, Math.Min(100, mfi)));
76 }
77 }
78 }
79​
80 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 14)
81 {
82 var mfi = new MoneyFlowIndex(period);
83 mfi.Calculate(candles);
84 return mfi.Values;
85 }
86 }
87}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (MoneyFlowIndex)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Money Flow Index (MFI) technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. What is MFI?
13// [Nickname] "Volume-Weighted RSI"
14// [Purpose] Measures buying/selling pressure by combining price AND volume.
15// [Range] 0 to 100 (like RSI)
16//
17// 2. Why Add Volume to RSI?
18// [Problem] RSI only looks at price changes, ignoring volume.
19// [Insight] A price move with high volume is more significant than one
20// with low volume.
21// [Solution] Weight the price change by the amount of money flowing in/out.
22//
23// 3. Calculation Steps
24//
25// Step 1: Typical Price (TP) = (High + Low + Close) / 3
26// Step 2: Raw Money Flow = TP × Volume
27// Step 3: Positive Flow = Sum of MF when TP is rising
28// Negative Flow = Sum of MF when TP is falling
29// Step 4: Money Flow Ratio = Positive Flow / Negative Flow
30// Step 5: MFI = 100 - (100 / (1 + MFR))
31//
32// 4. Signal Interpretation
33//
34// | MFI Level | Meaning |
35// |-----------|------------------------|
36// | > 80 | Overbought (sell zone) |
37// | < 20 | Oversold (buy zone) |
38// | 50 | Neutral |
39//
40// [Visual: MFI vs RSI Comparison]
41//
42// RSI: Only looks at price → "Did price go up or down?"
43// MFI: Looks at price × volume → "How much MONEY moved in/out?"
44//
45// =============================================================================
46​
47using System;
48using System.Collections.Generic;
49​
50namespace TechnicalIndicators
51{
52 // =============================================================================
53 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
54 // =============================================================================
55 public readonly record struct CandleData(
56 DateTime Timestamp,
57 decimal Open,
58 decimal High,
59 decimal Low,
60 decimal Close,
61 long Volume
62 );
63​
64 // =============================================================================
65 // Logic Explanation: Money Flow Index Class
66 // =============================================================================
67 public class MoneyFlowIndex
68 {
69 // -------------------------------------------------------------
70 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
71 // -------------------------------------------------------------
72 public int Period { get; }
73 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
74​
75 // =============================================================================
76 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
77 // =============================================================================
78 public MoneyFlowIndex(int period = 14)
79 {
80 if (period <= 0)
81 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(period), "Period must be greater than 0");
82
83 Period = period;
84 }
85​
86 // =============================================================================
87 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
88 // =============================================================================
89 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
90 {
91 // -------------------------------------------------------------
92 // Step 1: Cleanup & Validation
93 // -------------------------------------------------------------
94 Values.Clear();
95 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
96
97 // Need at least 2 candles to compare TP[today] vs TP[yesterday]
98 if (candleList.Count < 2) return;
99​
100 // -------------------------------------------------------------
101 // Step 2: Pre-calculate Typical Prices and Raw Money Flows
102 //
103 // [Formula]
104 // Typical Price (TP) = (High + Low + Close) / 3
105 // Raw Money Flow = TP × Volume
106 //
107 // [Why TP?]
108 // Single price (like Close) can be misleading.
109 // TP averages the range to get a more balanced view.
110 // -------------------------------------------------------------
111 var typicalPrices = new List<decimal>();
112 var rawMoneyFlows = new List<decimal>();
113​
114 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
115 {
116 decimal tp = (candleList[i].High + candleList[i].Low + candleList[i].Close) / 3;
117 typicalPrices.Add(tp);
118 rawMoneyFlows.Add(tp * candleList[i].Volume);
119 }
120​
121 // First candle has no previous TP to compare
122 Values.Add(null);
123​
124 // -------------------------------------------------------------
125 // Step 3: Main Loop
126 // -------------------------------------------------------------
127 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
128 {
129 // [Check] Need 'Period' bars of history
130 if (i < Period)
131 {
132 Values.Add(null);
133 continue;
134 }
135​
136 // -------------------------------------------------------------
137 // Step 4: Classify and Sum Money Flows
138 //
139 // [Visual: Positive vs Negative Flow]
140 //
141 // If TP[today] > TP[yesterday]:
142 // → Money is flowing IN (bullish pressure)
143 // → Add to Positive Flow
144 //
145 // If TP[today] < TP[yesterday]:
146 // → Money is flowing OUT (bearish pressure)
147 // → Add to Negative Flow
148 //
149 // If TP[today] == TP[yesterday]:
150 // → Neutral, not counted
151 // -------------------------------------------------------------
152 decimal positiveFlow = 0;
153 decimal negativeFlow = 0;
154​
155 for (int j = i - Period + 1; j <= i; j++)
156 {
157 if (typicalPrices[j] > typicalPrices[j - 1])
158 {
159 positiveFlow += rawMoneyFlows[j];
160 }
161 else if (typicalPrices[j] < typicalPrices[j - 1])
162 {
163 negativeFlow += rawMoneyFlows[j];
164 }
165 // If TP unchanged, money flow is not counted
166 }
167​
168 // -------------------------------------------------------------
169 // Step 5: Calculate MFI
170 //
171 // [Formula]
172 // Money Flow Ratio (MFR) = Positive Flow / Negative Flow
173 // MFI = 100 - (100 / (1 + MFR))
174 // = 100 × MFR / (1 + MFR)
175 // = 100 × Positive / (Positive + Negative)
176 //
177 // [Edge Case] If Negative Flow = 0, MFI = 100 (all bullish)
178 // -------------------------------------------------------------
179 if (negativeFlow == 0)
180 {
181 Values.Add(100);
182 }
183 else
184 {
185 decimal mfr = positiveFlow / negativeFlow;
186 decimal mfi = 100 - (100 / (1 + mfr));
187
188 // Clamp to [0, 100] for safety
189 Values.Add(Math.Max(0, Math.Min(100, mfi)));
190 }
191 }
192 }
193​
194 // =============================================================================
195 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
196 //
197 // [IPO Block]
198 // Input: IEnumerable<CandleData>, int period
199 // Process: Creates instance, runs Calculate()
200 // Output: List of MFI values (0-100)
201 // =============================================================================
202 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, int period = 14)
203 {
204 var mfi = new MoneyFlowIndex(period);
205 mfi.Calculate(candles);
206 return mfi.Values;
207 }
208 }
209}
python_simple:
1class MoneyFlowIndex:
2 """
3 Money Flow Index (MFI)
4 RSI weighting price changes by volume.
5 """
6 def __init__(self, period=14):
7 self.period = period
8 self.values = []
9​
10 def calculate(self, candles):
11 self.values.clear()
12 if len(candles) < 2: return
13​
14 typical_prices = []
15 raw_money_flows = []
16​
17 # 1. Pre-calc
18 for i in range(len(candles)):
19 tp = (float(candles[i]['high']) + float(candles[i]['low']) + float(candles[i]['close'])) / 3.0
20 typical_prices.append(tp)
21 raw_money_flows.append(tp * float(candles[i]['volume']))
22​
23 self.values.append(None) # Index 0
24​
25 # 2. Rolling Calc
26 for i in range(1, len(candles)):
27 if i < self.period:
28 self.values.append(None)
29 continue
30
31 p_flow = 0.0
32 n_flow = 0.0
33
34 for j in range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1):
35 if typical_prices[j] > typical_prices[j-1]:
36 p_flow += raw_money_flows[j]
37 elif typical_prices[j] < typical_prices[j-1]:
38 n_flow += raw_money_flows[j]
39
40 if n_flow == 0:
41 self.values.append(100.0)
42 else:
43 mfr = p_flow / n_flow
44 mfi = 100.0 - (100.0 / (1.0 + mfr))
45 # Clamp (Source clamps 0-100)
46 self.values.append(max(0.0, min(100.0, mfi)))
47​
48def calculate(candles, period=14):
49 mfi = MoneyFlowIndex(period)
50 mfi.calculate(candles)
51 return mfi.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Money Flow Index)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Money Flow Index (MFI). We explain *why* code is written this way
7# and *how* data transforms line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. Volume-Weighted RSI
11# Standard RSI looks only at Price Changes.
12# MFI looks at "Financial Mass" causing those changes.
13# - Momentum = Price x Volume.
14#
15# 2. Typical Price (TP)
16# - Most volume indicators use TP (High + Low + Close) / 3
17# - This represents the "Center of Gravity" for the day's trading.
18#
19# 3. Ratio Analysis
20# MFI calculates the ratio of "Bullish Flow" vs. "Bearish Flow".
21# - Bullish: Today's TP > Yesterday's TP.
22# - Bearish: Today's TP < Yesterday's TP.
23#
24# =============================================================================
25​
26# -------------------------------------------------------------
27# Type-Level Explanation: MoneyFlowIndex (class)
28#
29# [Why] Combines Price and Volume into a single oscillator.
30# [What] Measures Buying/Selling Pressure (0 to 100).
31# [How] Calculates the ratio of positive to negative "Money Flow" (Typical Price * Volume) over a period to generate a volume-weighted momentum oscillator similar to RSI.
32# [Visual]
33# /MFI (Line)
34# ./
35# ./
36# /
37# [Who] Smart Money Trackers.
38# [Where] Heap.
39# -------------------------------------------------------------
40class MoneyFlowIndex:
41​
42 # -------------------------------------------------------------
43 # Logic Explanation: Indicator Configuration (Public Properties)
44 #
45 # [Why]
46 # Standard configuration usually defaults to 14 periods.
47 # -------------------------------------------------------------
48​
49 # -------------------------------------------------------------
50 # Constructor: __init__
51 #
52 # [Input]
53 # - period: int (Window size)
54 #
55 # [Why]
56 # Initialize implementation constants.
57 # -------------------------------------------------------------
58 def __init__(self, period=14):
59
60 # -------------------------------------------------------------
61 # Logic Step 1: Validation
62 # -------------------------------------------------------------
63 if period <= 0:
64 raise ValueError("Period must be > 0.")
65​
66 self.period = period
67 self.values = []
68​
69​
70 # =============================================================================
71 # IPO: calculate
72 # =============================================================================
73 #
74 # [Input]
75 # - candles: list[dict] (Must have 'high', 'low', 'close', 'volume')
76 #
77 # [Process]
78 # 1. Pre-process Typical Price (TP) and Raw Money Flow (RMF).
79 # 2. Iterate sliding window.
80 # 3. In each window, sum Positive Flows and Negative Flows.
81 # 4. Compute Money Ratio = Pos / Neg.
82 # 5. Compute MFI = 100 - (100 / (1 + Ratio)).
83 #
84 # [Output]
85 # - None (populates self.values)
86 # =============================================================================
87 def calculate(self, candles):
88
89 # -------------------------------------------------------------
90 # Logic Step 1: Reset
91 # -------------------------------------------------------------
92 self.values.clear()
93 count = len(candles)
94
95 # Need at least 2 points for a diff (plus period)
96 if count < self.period + 1:
97 return
98​
99 # -------------------------------------------------------------
100 # Logic Step 2: Pre-Calculation (Vector Operations)
101 #
102 # [Why]
103 # TP and RMF calculations don't depend on the window.
104 # It's cleaner to compute them once for the whole array.
105 # -------------------------------------------------------------
106 tp_list = []
107 rmf_list = []
108
109 for c in candles:
110 # typical price = (H + L + C) / 3
111 tp = (c['high'] + c['low'] + c['close']) / 3.0
112 tp_list.append(tp)
113
114 # raw money flow = tp * volume
115 rmf = tp * c['volume']
116 rmf_list.append(rmf)
117​
118 # -------------------------------------------------------------
119 # Logic Step 3: Main Loop
120 # -------------------------------------------------------------
121 # First 1 + Period - 1 bars are insufficient?
122 # Note: MFI needs a "Previous TP" to classify flow.
123 # So Index 0 is unusable.
124 # Calculation starts at Index 1.
125 # Window needs 'period' comparisons.
126 # So first valid index is 'period'.
127
128 # Fill preamble with Nones
129 for _ in range(self.period):
130 self.values.append(None)
131​
132 for i in range(self.period, count):
133
134 pos_flow = 0.0
135 neg_flow = 0.0
136
137 # -------------------------------------------------------------
138 # Logic Step 3.1: Sum Flows in Window
139 #
140 # Iterate backwards 'period' times.
141 # Window covers indices [i - period + 1 ... i]
142 # BUT: Flow direction depends on comparison with [j - 1].
143 # -------------------------------------------------------------
144 for j in range(i - self.period + 1, i + 1):
145 current_tp = tp_list[j]
146 prev_tp = tp_list[j - 1] # Safe because j starts >= 1
147 flow = rmf_list[j]
148
149 # ---------------------------------------------------------
150 # Decision: Pos or Neg?
151 # ---------------------------------------------------------
152 if current_tp > prev_tp:
153 # Up Day
154 pos_flow += flow
155 elif current_tp < prev_tp:
156 # Down Day
157 neg_flow += flow
158 # Else (Equal): Discarded (Neutral)
159​
160 # -------------------------------------------------------------
161 # Logic Step 3.2: Compute Ratio & Index
162 #
163 # [Formula]
164 # Ratio = Pos / Neg
165 # MFI = 100 - (100 / (1 + Ratio))
166 # -------------------------------------------------------------
167 if neg_flow == 0.0:
168 # Infinite Ratio -> MFI converges to 100
169 self.values.append(100.0)
170 else:
171 money_ratio = pos_flow / neg_flow
172 mfi = 100.0 - (100.0 / (1.0 + money_ratio))
173 self.values.append(mfi)
174​
175​
176# =============================================================================
177# Functional Wrapper (Procedural Interface)
178# =============================================================================
179def calculate(candles, period=14):
180 """
181 Computes Money Flow Index (Volume-Weighted RSI).
182 """
183 # 1. Instantiation
184 instance = MoneyFlowIndex(period)
185
186 # 2. Execution
187 instance.calculate(candles)
188
189 # 3. Extraction
190 return instance.values
